oai_dc:dc.dc:title: "Dr. Pearce was a leader for women"
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: medicine; Pearce, Iris A.; women; 2000s;
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: "...One of two women in her class to graduate from the University of Tennessee Medical School in 1950, she was a pioneer for women in medicine... -- ...Dr. Pearce became the first woman to be appointed chief resident at the City of Memphis Hospital (now the Regional Medical Center at Memphis) and went on to become the first woman to serve as medical director there. She also was a faculty member at the University of Tennessee Health Science Center..."
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Price, Stephen D.
